snippet: President Obama and Prime Minister David Cameron of Britain addressed concerns in the Middle East and said they would stick by their timetable for Afghanistan.
abstract: President Obama and Prime Minister David Cameron of Britain, in joint press conference, pledge to adhere to the timetable for winding down the war in Afghanistan by the end of 2014; also address concerns about the Middle East, affirming the need to allow economic sanctions to take their toll before considering military action in Iran; they appear united on Syria, but their solid front appears to be born of frustration.
lead_paragraph: President Obama and Prime Minister David Cameron of Britain addressed concerns in the Middle East and said they would stick by their timetable for Afghanistan.

headline.seo: Obama and Cameron Stand United on Afghanistan
headline.main: Cameron and Obama Show Unity on Afghanistan
headline.print_headline: Obama and Cameron Present United Front on Afghanistan, Iran and Syria
